info.title: Marketing Campaigns Public Api
info.x-hubspot-introduction: You can use campaign endpoints to create, read, update, and delete marketing campaign data. For example, you can use these endpoints to create and manage HubSpot campaigns from your external applications. You can also transfer campaign data to external data warehouses for analytics.

get.summary: Read campaign spend item
get.description: Read a campaign spend item by its spendId

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign.

parameters.description: Unique identifier for the spend item.

post.summary: Update a batch of campaigns
post.description:
This endpoint updates a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data.
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
If an empty string ("") is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.

put.description:
Associate a specified asset with a campaign. Using the API, you can create and remove associations for the following asset types: forms, static lists, external website pages, sequences, meetings, playbooks, feedback surveys, podcast episodes, sales documents, marketing emails, case studies, knowledge base articles, calls, and CTAs. 

For other asset types, it is recommended to manage your associations directly in the campaign tool in HubSpot.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description:
The type of asset
Important: Currently, only the following asset types are available for association via the API: FORM, OBJECT_LIST, EXTERNAL_WEB_URL

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: Id of the asset

delete.description:
Disassociate a specified asset from a campaign.
Important: Currently, only the following asset types can be associated and disassociated via the API: Forms, Static lists, External website pages

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description:
The type of asset
Important: Currently, only the following asset types are available for disassociation via the API: FORM, OBJECT_LIST, EXTERNAL_WEB_URL

parameters.name: assetId
parameters.description: Id of the asset

get.summary: Read budget
get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about the budget and spend items for a specified campaign, including the total budget, total spend, and remaining budget.
Budget and Spend items may be returned in any order, but the order field specifies their sequence based on the creation date. The item with order 0 is the oldest, and items with higher order values are newer

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

post.summary: Read a batch of campaigns
post.description:
This endpoint reads a batch of campaigns based on the provided input data and returns the campaigns along with their associated assets. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.
If duplicate campaign IDs are provided in the request, duplicates will be ignored. The response will include only unique IDs and will be returned without duplicates.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

prev.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

get.summary: Campaign search
get.description: This endpoint allows users to search for and return a page of campaigns based on various query parameters. Users can filter by name, sort, and paginate through the campaigns, as well as control which properties are returned in the response.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field by which to sort the results. Allowed values are hs_name, createdAt, updatedAt. An optional '-' before the property name can denote descending order
Default: hs_name

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
A cursor for pagination. If provided, the results will start after the given cursor.
Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return. Allowed values range from 1 to 100
Default: 50

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: A filter to return campaigns whose names contain the specified substring. This allows partial matching of campaign names, returning all campaigns that include the given substring in their name. If this parameter is not provided, the search will return all campaigns

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

post.summary: Create a campaign
post.description: Create a campaign with the given properties and return the campaign object, including the campaignGuid and created properties.

get.summary: Get Campaign Metrics
get.description: This endpoint retrieves key attribution metrics for a specified campaign, such as sessions, new contacts, and influenced contacts.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
The start date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: 2006-01-01

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
End date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: Current date

get.summary: List assets
get.description:
This endpoint lists all assets of the campaign by asset type. The assetType parameter is required, and each request can only fetch assets of a single type.
Asset metrics can also be fetched along with the assets; they are available only if start and end dates are provided.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: assetType
parameters.description: The type of asset to fetch.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
A cursor for pagination. If provided, the results will start after the given cursor.
Example: NTI1Cg%3D%3D

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
The maximum number of results to return.
Default: 10

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

post.summary: Delete a batch of campaigns
post.description:
This endpoint deletes a batch of campaigns. 
The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The response will always be 204 No Content, regardless of whether the campaigns exist or not, whether they were successfully deleted or not, or if only some of the campaigns in the batch were deleted.

get.summary: Fetch revenue
get.description: Fetch revenue attribution report data for a specified campaign

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: attributionModel
parameters.description:
Allowed values: LINEAR, FIRST_INTERACTION, LAST_INTERACTION, FULL_PATH, U_SHAPED, W_SHAPED, TIME_DECAY, J_SHAPED, INVERSE_J_SHAPED
Default value: LINEAR

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
The start date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: 2006-01-01

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
End date for the report data, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD.
Default value: Current date

post.summary: Create a batch of campaigns
post.description:
This endpoint creates a batch of campaigns. The maximum number of items in a batch request is 50.
The campaigns in the response are not guaranteed to be in the same order as they were provided in the request.

get.summary: Read a campaign
get.description: Get a campaign identified by a specific campaignGuid with the given properties. Along with the campaign information, it also returns information about assets. Depending on the query parameters used, this can also be used to return information about the corresponding assets' metrics. Metrics are available only if startDate and endDate are provided.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description:
Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description:
End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period.
If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object, they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

before.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving previous pages.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the previous pages' results.

prev.description: specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the previous set of results in a paginated API response

delete.description:
Delete a specified campaign from the system.
This call will return a 204 No Content response regardless of whether the campaignGuid provided corresponds to an existing campaign or not.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

patch.description:
Perform a partial update of a campaign identified by the specified campaignGuid. Provided property values will be overwritten. Read-only and non-existent properties will cause 400 error.
If an empty string is passed for any property in the Batch Update, it will reset that property's value.

parameters.name: campaignGuid
parameters.description: Unique identifier for the campaign, formatted as a UUID.

hidden.description: Whether a field should be hidden or not. Hidden fields won't appear on the form, but can be used to pass a value to a property without requiring the customer to fill it in.

defaultValue.description: The value filled in by default. This value will be submitted unless the customer modifies it.

name.description: The identifier of the field. In combination with the object type ID, it must be unique.

description.description: Additional text helping the customer to complete the field.

dependentFields.description: A list of other fields to make visible based on the value filled in for this field.

legalConsentOptions.communicationConsentText: Fancy Forms, LLC is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, and we’ll only use your personal information to administer your account and to provide the products and services you requested from us. From time to time, we would like to contact you about our products and services, as well as other content that may be of interest to you. If you consent to us contacting you for this purpose, please tick below to say how you would like us to contact you:

communicationsCheckboxes.label: I agree to receive other communications from Fancy Forms, LLC.

legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessText: In order to provide you the content requested, we need to store and process your personal data. If you consent to us storing your personal data for this purpose, please tick the checkbox below.
legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessCheckboxLabel: I agree to allow Fancy Forms, LLC to store and process my personal data.
legalConsentOptions.privacyText: You can unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information on how to unsubscribe, our privacy practices, and how we are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, please review our Privacy Policy.

renderRawHtml.description: Whether the form will render as raw HTML as opposed to inside an iFrame.

legalConsentOptions.communicationConsentText: Fancy Forms, LLC is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, and we’ll only use your personal information to administer your account and to provide the products and services you requested from us. From time to time, we would like to contact you about our products and services, as well as other content that may be of interest to you. If you consent to us contacting you for this purpose, please tick below to say how you would like us to contact you:

communicationsCheckboxes.label: I agree to receive other communications from Fancy Forms, LLC.

legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessText: In order to provide you the content requested, we need to store and process your personal data. If you consent to us storing your personal data for this purpose, please tick the checkbox below.
legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessCheckboxLabel: I agree to allow Fancy Forms, LLC to store and process my personal data.
legalConsentOptions.privacyText: You can unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information on how to unsubscribe, our privacy practices, and how we are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, please review our Privacy Policy.

delete.description: Archive a form definition. New submissions will not be accepted and the form definition will be permanently deleted after 3 months.

legalConsentOptions.communicationConsentText: Fancy Forms, LLC is committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, and we’ll only use your personal information to administer your account and to provide the products and services you requested from us. From time to time, we would like to contact you about our products and services, as well as other content that may be of interest to you. If you consent to us contacting you for this purpose, please tick below to say how you would like us to contact you:

communicationsCheckboxes.label: I agree to receive other communications from Fancy Forms, LLC.

legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessText: In order to provide you the content requested, we need to store and process your personal data. If you consent to us storing your personal data for this purpose, please tick the checkbox below.
legalConsentOptions.consentToProcessCheckboxLabel: I agree to allow Fancy Forms, LLC to store and process my personal data.
legalConsentOptions.privacyText: You can unsubscribe from these communications at any time. For more information on how to unsubscribe, our privacy practices, and how we are committed to protecting and respecting your privacy, please review our Privacy Policy.

get.summary: Get a list of forms
get.description: Returns a list of forms based on the search filters. By default, it returns the first 20 `hubspot` forms

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The paging cursor token of the last successfully read resource will be returned as the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to display per page.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: Whether to return only results that have been archived.

parameters.name: formTypes
parameters.description: The form types to be included in the results.

link.description: A URL that can be used to retrieve the next page results.

after.description: A paging cursor token for retrieving subsequent pages.

next.description: Specifies the paging information needed to retrieve the next set of results in a paginated API response

richTextType.description: The type of rich text included. The default value is text.

richText.description: A block of rich text or an image. Those can be used to add extra information for the customers filling in the form. If the field group includes fields, the rich text will be displayed before the fields.

fields.description: The form fields included in the group

hidden.description: Whether a field should be hidden or not. Hidden fields won't appear on the form, but can be used to pass a value to a property without requiring the customer to fill it in.

defaultValue.description: The value filled in by default. This value will be submitted unless the customer modifies it.

name.description: The identifier of the field. In combination with the object type ID, it must be unique.

dependentFields.description: A list of other fields to make visible based on the value filled in for this field.

get.summary: Get aggregated statistics
get.description: Use this endpoint to get aggregated statistics of emails sent in a specified time span. It also returns the list of emails that were sent during the time span.

emails.description: List of email IDs that were sent during the time span.

qualifierStats.description: Number of emails that were dropped and bounced.
Number of emails that were dropped and bounced.

schema.description: Aggregated statistics for the given interval, plus the IDs of emails that were sent during that interval.

post.summary: Create an A/B test variation
post.description: Create a new variation for an email A/B test

contentId.description: ID of the object to test.

schema.description: Request body object for creating A/B tests.

feedbackSurveyId.description: The ID of the feedback survey linked to the email.

publishDate.description: The date and time the email is scheduled for, in ISO8601 representation. This is only used in local time or scheduled emails.

isTransactional.description: Returns whether the email is a transactional email or not. This is read only.

type.description: The email type, this is derived from other properties on the email such as subcategory.

additionalProperties.description: An email field whose value is controlled by one or more smart rules.

content.description: Data structure representing the content of the email.

archived.description: Determines if the email is archived or not.

createdAt.description: The date and time of the email's creation, in ISO8601 representation.

qualifierStats.description: Number of emails that were dropped and bounced.

customReplyTo.description: The reply to recipients will see.

replyTo.description: The from address and reply to email address (if no customReplyTo defined) recipients will see.

from.description: Data structure representing the from fields on the email.

createdById.description: The id of the user who created the email.

updatedAt.description: The date and time of the last update to the email, in ISO8601 representation.

rssData.description: RSS related data if it is a blog or rss email.

publishedAt.description: The date and time the email was published at, in ISO8601 representation.

isPublished.description: Returns the published status of the email. This is read only.

abSamplingDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if the results are inconclusive after the test period, master or variant.

abSampleSizeDefault.description: Version of the email that should be sent if there are too few recipients to conduct an AB test.

abTestPercentage.description: The size of your test group.

hoursToWait.description: Time limit on gathering test results. After this time is up, the winning version will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testId.description: The ID of the AB test.

abSuccessMetric.description: Metric to determine the version that will be sent to the remaining contacts.

testing.description: AB testing related data. This property is only returned for AB type emails.

updatedById.description: The id of the user who last updated the email.

officeLocationId.description: ID of the selected office location.

subscriptionDetails.description: Data structure representing the subscription fields of the email.

name.description: The name of the email, as displayed on the email dashboard.

activeDomain.description: The active domain of the email.

campaign.description: The ID of the campaign this email is associated to.

contactIlsLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactIds.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

contactLists.description: Data structure representing lists of IDs that should be included and excluded.

to.description: Data structure representing the to fields of the email.

sendOnPublish.description: Determines whether the email will be sent immediately on publish.

schema.description: A marketing email

content.plainTextVersion:
This is custom! View in browser ({{view_as_page_url}})

Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,

Your full name

Your job title

Other contact information

{{site_settings.company_name}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_1}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_2}}, {{site_settings.company_city}}, {{site_settings.company_state}} {{site_settings.company_zip}}, {{site_settings.company_country}}, {{site_settings.company_phone}}

Unsubscribe ({{unsubscribe_link_all}})

Manage preferences ({{unsubscribe_link}})

Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,
Your full name
Your job title
Other contact information

schema.description: Response object for collections of marketing emails with pagination information.

body.html:
Hi {{contact.firstname}},

This is an example of an email in HubSpot. You can add and format text, include your own images, and even personalize the message with details about the recipient, like their {{contact.company}} or {{contact.city}}.

In HubSpot, the Email tool is closely linked with the Lists and Workflows tools. You can create a list of recipients on the "Sending" tab up above. If you want this email to be part of a nurturing series, you can make it part of a workflow.

Need help? Check out the documentation on creating an email, creating a list, or creating a workflow.

Something Powerful

Tell The Reader More

The headline and subheader tells us what you're offering, and the form header closes the deal. Over here you can explain why your offer is so great it's worth filling out a form for.

Remember:

  • Bullets are great
  • For spelling out benefits and
  • Turning visitors into leads.

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,

Your full name

Your job title

Other contact information

{{site_settings.company_name}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_1}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_2}}, {{site_settings.company_city}}, {{site_settings.company_state}} {{site_settings.company_zip}}, {{site_settings.company_country}}, {{site_settings.company_phone}}

Unsubscribe ({{unsubscribe_link_all}})

Manage preferences ({{unsubscribe_link}})

body.html:
Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,
Your full name
Your job title
Other contact information

post.summary: Record Participants by ContactId with Marketing Event External Ids

Records the participation of multiple HubSpot contacts in a Marketing Event using their HubSpot contact IDs.

Additional Functionality:

Allowed Properties:
For the state "attend":

- leftAt

parameters.name: subscriberState
parameters.description: The new subscriber state for the HubSpot contacts and the specified marketing event. For example: 'register', 'attend' or 'cancel'.

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

inputs.description: List of HubSpot contacts to subscribe to the marketing event

interactionDateTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds at which the contact subscribed to the event.

get.summary: Get Marketing Event by External IDs
get.description:
Returns the details of a Marketing Event with the specified externalAccountId, externalEventId, if it exists.

Only Marketing Events created by the same app making the request can be retrieved.

parameters.name: externalEventId
parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application

parameters.name: externalAccountId
parameters.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application

registrants.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

attendees.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that attended this marketing event.

eventType.description: The type of the marketing event.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

noShows.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but did not attend. This field only had a value when the event is over.

cancellations.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but later cancelled their registration.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

sourceId.description: The ID of the property source indicating where it was created.

selectedByUser.description: Whether the value was selected by a user.

source.description: The origin of the property value, such as "IMPORT" or "API".

updatedByUserId.description: The ID of the user who updated the property.

sourceMetadata.description: Source metadata encoded as a base64 string. For example: `ZXhhbXBsZSBzdHJpbmc=`

dataSensitivity.description: The sensitivity level of the property, such as "non_sensitive", "sensitive", and "highly_sensitive".

sourceVid.description: The unique identifier associated with the source.

unit.description: The unit of measurement or context for the value.

requestId.description: A unique ID associated with this request.

isEncrypted.description: Whether the property value is encrypted.

name.description: Name of custom property

value.description: Custom property value

selectedByUserTimestamp.description: The timestamp when the value was selected by a user, if applicable.

timestamp.description: When the value was set, as a 64-bit integer.

items.description: Represents a single custom property of a marketing event, storing its name, value, metadata (like source, timestamp, and sensitivity), and related audit information for tracking changes.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

post.summary: Delete Multiple Marketing Events by ObjectId
post.description:
Deletes multiple Marketing Events from the portal based on their objectId, if they exist.

Responses:
204: Returned if all specified Marketing Events were successfully deleted.
207: Returned if some objectIds did not correspond to any existing Marketing Events.

get.summary: Find Marketing Events by External Event Id
get.description:
This endpoint searches the portal for all Marketing Events whose externalEventId matches the value provided in the request.

It retrieves the objectId and additional event details for each matching Marketing Event.

Since multiple Marketing Events can have the same externalEventId, the endpoint returns all matching results.

Note: Marketing Events become searchable by externalEventId a few minutes after creation.

parameters.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

post.summary: Send an email
post.description: Send a template email to a specific recipient.

customProperties.description:
The customProperties field is a map of property values. Each property value contains a name and value property. Each property will be visible in the template under {{ custom.NAME }}.
Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the email, which can be found in email tool UI.

cc.description: List of email addresses to send as Cc.

sendId.description: ID for a particular send. No more than one email will be sent per sendId.

bcc.description: List of email addresses to send as Bcc.

replyTo.description: List of Reply-To header values for the email.

from.description: The From header for the email.

message.description: A JSON object containing anything you want to override.

contactProperties.description: The contactProperties field is a map of contact property values. Each contact property value contains a name and value property. Each property will get set on the contact record and will be visible in the template under {{ contact.NAME }}. Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a receipt you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

schema.description: A request to send a single email asynchronously.

eventId.description: The ID of a send event.

completedAt.description: Time when the send was completed.

statusId.description: Identifier used to query the status of the send.

requestedAt.description: Time when the send was requested.

startedAt.description: Time when the send began processing.

schema.description: Describes the status of an email send request.

post.summary: Send a single transactional email asynchronously.
post.description: Asynchronously send a transactional email. Returns the status of the email send with a statusId that can be used to continuously query for the status using the Email Send Status API.

requestBody.description: A request object describing the email to send.

customProperties.description:
The customProperties field is a map of property values. Each property value contains a name and value property. Each property will be visible in the template under {{ custom.NAME }}.
Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the transactional email, which can be found in email tool UI.

cc.description: List of email addresses to send as Cc.

sendId.description: ID for a particular send. No more than one email will be sent per sendId.

bcc.description: List of email addresses to send as Bcc.

replyTo.description: List of Reply-To header values for the email.

from.description: The From header for the email.

message.description: A JSON object containing anything you want to override.

contactProperties.description: The contactProperties field is a map of contact property values. Each contact property value contains a name and value property. Each property will get set on the contact record and will be visible in the template under {{ contact.NAME }}. Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a reciept you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

schema.description: A request to send a single transactional email asynchronously.

eventId.description: The ID of a send event.

completedAt.description: Time when the send was completed.

statusId.description: Identifier used to query the status of the send.

requestedAt.description: Time when the send was requested.

startedAt.description: Time when the send began processing.

schema.description: Describes the status of an email send request.

DependentField.description: A form field that will be displayed based on what the customer entered in another field.

renderRawHtml.description: Whether the form will render as raw HTML as opposed to inside an iFrame.

objectTypeId.description: A unique ID for this field's CRM object type. For example a CONTACT field will have the object type ID 0-1.

hidden.description: Whether a field should be hidden or not. Hidden fields won't appear on the form, but can be used to pass a value to a property without requiring the customer to fill it in.

defaultValue.description: The value filled in by default. This value will be submitted unless the customer modifies it.

name.description: The identifier of the field. In combination with the object type ID, it must be unique.

description.description: Additional text helping the customer to complete the field.

dependentFields.description: A list of other fields to make visible based on the value filled in for this field.

label.description: The main label for the form field.

placeholder.description: The prompt text showing when the field isn't filled in.

fieldType.description: Determines how the field will be displayed and validated.

required.description: Whether a value for this field is required when submitting the form.

content.plainTextVersion:
This is custom! View in browser ({{view_as_page_url}})

Hello {{ contact.firstname }},

Plain text emails have minimal formatting so your reader can really focus on what you have to say. Introduce yourself and explain why you’re reaching out.

Every email should try to lead the reader to some kind of action. Use this space to describe why the reader should want to click on the link below. Put the link on its own line to really draw their eye to it.

Link text

Now it’s time to wrap up your email. Before your signature, thank the recipient for reading. You can also invite them to send this email to any of their colleagues who might be interested.

All the best,

Your full name

Your job title

Other contact information

{{site_settings.company_name}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_1}}, {{site_settings.company_street_address_2}}, {{site_settings.company_city}}, {{site_settings.company_state}} {{site_settings.company_zip}}, {{site_settings.company_country}}, {{site_settings.company_phone}}

Unsubscribe ({{unsubscribe_link_all}})

Manage preferences ({{unsubscribe_link}})

registrants.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event.

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

noShows.description: The number of HubSpot contacts that registered for this marketing event, but did not attend. This field only had a value when the event is over.

startDateTime.description: The start date and time of the marketing event.

customProperties.description:
A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

A list of PropertyValues. These can be whatever kind of property names and values you want. However, they must already exist on the HubSpot account's definition of the MarketingEvent Object. If they don't they will be filtered out and not set.
In order to do this you'll need to create a new PropertyGroup on the HubSpot account's MarketingEvent object for your specific app and create the Custom Property you want to track on that HubSpot account. Do not create any new default properties on the MarketingEvent object as that will apply to all HubSpot accounts.

externalAccountId.description: The accountId that is associated with this marketing event in the external event application.

eventCancelled.description: Indicates if the marketing event has been cancelled.  Defaults to `false`

eventOrganizer.description: The name of the organizer of the marketing event.

eventUrl.description: A URL in the external event application where the marketing event can be managed.

externalEventId.description: The id of the marketing event in the external event application.

eventDescription.description: The description of the marketing event.

eventName.description: The name of the marketing event.

eventType.description: Describes what type of event this is.  For example: `WEBINAR`, `CONFERENCE`, `WORKSHOP`

endDateTime.description: The end date and time of the marketing event.

appId.description: The id of the application the settings are for

eventDetailsUrl.description: The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id

interactionDateTime.description: Timestamp in milliseconds at which the contact subscribed to the event.

eventDetailsUrl.description: The url that will be used to fetch marketing event details by id. Must contain a `%s` character sequence that will be substituted with the event id. For example: `https://my.event.app/events/%s`

inputs.description: List of marketing event details to create or update

completedAt.description: Time when the send was completed.

statusId.description: Identifier used to query the status of the send.

requestedAt.description: Time when the send was requested.

startedAt.description: Time when the send began processing.

EmailSendStatusView.description: Describes the status of an email send request.

customProperties.description:
The customProperties field is a map of property values. Each property value contains a name and value property. Each property will be visible in the template under {{ custom.NAME }}.
Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the email, which can be found in email tool UI.

contactProperties.description: The contactProperties field is a map of contact property values. Each contact property value contains a name and value property. Each property will get set on the contact record and will be visible in the template under {{ contact.NAME }}. Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a receipt you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

PublicSingleSendRequestEgg.description: A request to send a single email asynchronously.

EventIdView.description: The ID of a send event.

cc.description: List of email addresses to send as Cc.

sendId.description: ID for a particular send. No more than one email will be sent per sendId.

bcc.description: List of email addresses to send as Bcc.

replyTo.description: List of Reply-To header values for the email.

from.description: The From header for the email.

PublicSingleSendEmail.description: A JSON object containing anything you want to override.

completedAt.description: Time when the send was completed.

statusId.description: Identifier used to query the status of the send.

requestedAt.description: Time when the send was requested.

startedAt.description: Time when the send began processing.

EmailSendStatusView2.description: Describes the status of an email send request.

createContact.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients.

campaignName.description: A name for the campaign tied to the SMTP API token.

SmtpApiTokenRequestEgg.description: A request object to create a SMTP API token

customProperties.description:
The customProperties field is a map of property values. Each property value contains a name and value property. Each property will be visible in the template under {{ custom.NAME }}.
Note: Custom properties do not currently support arrays. To provide a listing in an email, one workaround is to build an HTML list (either with tables or ul) and specify it as a custom property.

emailId.description: The content ID for the transactional email, which can be found in email tool UI.

contactProperties.description: The contactProperties field is a map of contact property values. Each contact property value contains a name and value property. Each property will get set on the contact record and will be visible in the template under {{ contact.NAME }}. Use these properties when you want to set a contact property while you’re sending the email. For example, when sending a reciept you may want to set a last_paid_date property, as the sending of the receipt will have information about the last payment.

PublicSingleSendRequestEgg2.description: A request to send a single transactional email asynchronously.

createdAt.description: Timestamp generated when a token is created.

password.description: Password used to log into the HubSpot SMTP server.

createdBy.description: Email address of the user that sent the token creation request.

createContact.description: Indicates whether a contact should be created for email recipients.

id.description: User name to log into the HubSpot SMTP server.

emailCampaignId.description: Identifier assigned to the campaign provided in the token creation request.

campaignName.description: A name for the campaign tied to the token.

SmtpApiTokenView.description: A SMTP API token provides both an ID and password that can be used to send email through the HubSpot SMTP API.
